lead_paragraph: Because of an editing error, a picture caption and an article on Monday about Ryan Hall’s fifth-place finish in the London Marathon referred imprecisely in some editions to his accomplishment. Hall became the second-fastest American marathoner, but his time of 2:06:17 was not the second-fastest performance ever. That distinction is held by Khalid Khannouchi, who has run the top two times since becoming a United States citizen. The article also misstated, in some editions, the overall ranking for Hall’s performance. It was the 22nd-fastest marathon in history, not the 18th fastest.
